title: FIREFOX 83 DOES NOT AL,LOW ME TO RE-LOG ON TO THE NAVY FEDERAL CRFEDIT UNION WEBSITE
content:
Edition Windows 10 Home Single Language Version 20H2 OS build 19042.685 Firefox 83.0

Situation: If I clear my web content and delete al the cookies for Navy Federal Credit Union (NFCU) (https://my.navyfederal.org/NFOAA_Auth/login.jsp - Image 1) ) I can log in to the web site with no problems. I get the 2 factor security code by email and it enables me to view my accounts. However, after I log out, I cannot log back in again Example: When I start to re-log in, after I enter my userID and password (Image 1) , I am taken to an Online Banking signon page (Image 2) but it only stays on screen for a couple of seconds and then reverts back to the main login page, i.e., https://my.navyfederal.org/NFOAA_Auth/login.jsp. (Image 1) In order to log back in to the website I must delete the web content, the NFCU cookies and refresh the browser page in Options>Privacy & Security.

The Online Banking signon page (image 2) also has a button to check to have the site remember me so I don't have to get the 2 factor code every time, but that does not work in Firefox 83 either.

I have no difficulty in logging in or re-logging in to that site using IE, Edge or Brave Browser. I had no problems logging in using Firefox 82 and below. So it appears that the issue is in FF83.

I asked NFCU about tis and they replied as follows: "The Mozilla Firefox browser just updated to 83.0 on 11/17/2020. There are times in which Firefox does not like to connect to our servers after an update. It can take some time for Navy Federal to connection properly with Firefox again. However, this would not affect the 2-Step Verification system.

A few things can cause the 2-Step Verification to prompt upon every login. If you have your web browser clear your cache and cookies upon closing, this will prevent the 2-Step information from being store [I do not use that setting] . The same thing happens when you use Private or Incognito browsers. [I have not been using private or incognito browsers except Brave and I am not having problems in that browser] There are also certain security systems that will prevent the 2-Step information from being store as well. I have Malwarebytes free running in the background, but I took it out and that did not fix the problem, so I reinstalled it. I use MS Windows Defender as my main security program with Superantispyware on demand. I run my default browser (FF) in Sandboxie, running FF outside of the sandbox and it has the same problem. I have tried disabling extensions, running the browser in troubleshooting mode, safe mode, etc. I don't know what else to try to get a permanent fix for this.

title: Facebook y Mozilla
content: Buenos días, hace ya algun tiempo que tengo problemas con la navegación en Facebook con Mozilla Firefox, tengo una pc, no muy potente (en mi trabajo) pero que relativamente funciona muy bien, y puedo navegar sin inconvenientes en todas las páginas, incluso puedo trabajar con varias pestañas al mismo tiempo reproduciendo videos, etc. Sin mayores inconvenientes, pero cuando abro Facebook, la pc directamente se muere. El Consumo es muy elevado, tanto de CPU como de RAM, alcanzando el 95% del CPU en algunos casos y la RAM al 100%. En principio pensé que podía tratarse solo de la pc de bajos recursos, pero luego probé con el navegador Chrome y no hay ningún problema en la navegación (Siempre hablando de Facebook) Por lo que me queda muy en claro que es un problema específico de Mozilla y Facebook. Me he dado cuenta que el consumo se sale de control cuando aparecen Videos, Gifs u otras animaciones, esto con Chrome no sucede, por lo que no es un problema de gráficos de la pc, sino de como se ejecuta lo anteriormente mencionado en este navegador. Espero se pueda corregir o servir para investigar el funcionamiento en general, ya que siempre he usado este navegador y no quisiera cambiarlo aqui en la oficina para poder mirar de vez en cuando el mencionado sitio web. Muchas Gracias.

title: Firefox is grinding my HDD for no reason and lagging
content:
If I've been leaving Firefox (v83.0, 64-bit) open for a long time, it's because I'm on Facebook and YouTube. However, after long sessions on Facebook, when I switch to YouTube, I'll get two really annoying effects:

1) When I start watching a video, the Firefox browser will start grinding away at my hard drive, as if Windows Defrag function started running in the background - that level of grinding. I know this because I checked it with Windows Process Explorer, and there were multiple instances of Firefox running, sometimes as many as 7 instances. I don't know what Firefox is doing, but it was impacting my computer's performance, **even if I stopped the video I was watching and all other programs **. The only way to get it to stop was to close Firefox, and then re-open it with Restart Previous Session, and then it quit.

I don't know why Firefox needs 7 sessions open at once, but they're not mine, and they're grinding performance badly. Can anyone tell me why this is happening, and if it's possible to stop it?

2) Linked to #1 is a huge lag problem at times when I use YouTube, which goes away when I restart Firefox. I'll click on a link in YouTube, and literally nothing happens for as much as 3 seconds. Restart Firefox, and it goes away.

I'm wondering if there's a huge memory leak in Firefox, and if there's any way to check that.

I've got 32 GB of RAM, an I7 CPU, and hundreds of GB of disk space, so none of this should be happening. Any ideas?

title: Firefox seek issues with HTML5
content:
We have a web application which used to play an audio using the adobe flash. Since firefox is going to stop the flash support in its browser, we are migrating to HTML5 audio. However, we are facing the seek issue which has been reported previously and has not been resolved as of now. The seeks does not seem to work correctly with Variable bit rate signals even in the latest version. On seeking to a particular timestamp, it plays the part of song which should ideally play 3 seconds after the seeked timestamp. I am using 256kbps VBR signal.

If flash is being unsupported starting in 2021, It will be not be possible to play music with precision on firefox using HTML5 player

Related issues:

1) https://stackoverflow.com/questions/22911175/html5-audio-starts-from-the-wrong-position-in-firefox 2) https://stackoverflow.com/questions/32144092/inconsistent-seeking-in-html5-audio-player 3) https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=994561

To reproduce the issue, play an audio with 256kbps bitrate using html audio tag. Seek to some random position in the song and compare it sound played at that instant with the actual song.

title: YouTube Input Lag/Delay on Windows: SOLVED
content:
Hi there, not a question but I wanted to put this out there for those who may be running into the same issue as me. I hate searching for things and not finding a straight answer, and I'm hoping that I can bring light to others who may be undergoing the same issue.

I was infuriated by YouTube (and only YouTube) and how slow it was to respond to pretty much any command I sent via my keyboard. Clicking was fine, but if I wanted to skip 5 seconds in the video by mashing the right or left arrow a bunch, it would buffer those key presses and then register all at once. Basically, YouTube was lagging out of its mind and decided that any kind of action I wanted to take on the page would be done incredibly slowly (by modern computing standards, so ~700ms). I play rhythm games, so any input delay more than about 2ms will annoy me to no end.

This ended up being something called GC or garbage collection, and it was "minor GC" and "non-incremental GC" and something to do with a Nursery being full. Whatever that is, switching over to the Call Tree function in the F12 performance menu (F12>Performance>Start Recording Performance>*input commands on video*>Call Tree) told me that the function GC was taking up around HALF of my time recorded. This gave me a place to start at least, and I'm glad that Firefox has this feature and that it's user friendly. I know NOTHING about webpage design or coding, and it wasn't that hard to figure out what was going on.

Expanding the menus was helpful, and I found out that it was actually my Kaspersky Antivirus causing the issue. I dug around for another hour or so and found this helpful article on how to fix it.

A TL;DR from that article is, if you have Kaspersky, go to Settings>Additional>Network and untick "Inject scripts into web traffic to interact with web pages"

This script injection was doing something to slow it down, most likely trying to scan and monitor the inputs I was making on YouTube to be sure I wasn't getting myself into any trouble. Hope that this helps anyone else having this issue, and any moderation can mark this as solved.
creator: jahinson2002

title: Velocidad de subida lenta en Firefox
content:
Hola a todos!

Tengo un problema con Firefox y es que la subida de archivos grandes es demasiado lenta en comparación a otros navegadores.

El problema Al intenter subir un archivo a cualquier sitio que lo permita la velocidad de subida en Firefox se ve limitada a 25 mbps mientras que intentarlo en cualquier navegador basado en Chromium subiendo el mismo archivo al mismo sitio la velocidad de subida es alta alcanzando el limite de mi conexión

Conexión a internet Internet fibra optica de 300 megas con subida de 200mbps Conexión con WI-FI 5GHZ

Entorno de subida he intentado subir un archivo de 600MB a diferentes sitios de almacenamiento en la nube y YouTube pasa lo siguiente Navegadores basados en Chromium la velocidad de subida alcanza el limite de subida de mi conexión de internet mientras que en firefox se queda en maximo unos 28mbps. (ver imagenes)

Equipo Modelo: Laptop HP Pavilion Gaming 15 SO: Windows 10 (20H2)

Navegadores usados - Google Chrome - Edge (basado en Chromium) - Firefox

Sitios donde he probado a subir archivos Mediafire Dropbox YouTube OneDrive Google Drive Google Photos

No se si es un problema interno de Firefox o que las paginas limitan las capacidades del navegador para hacerlo lucir lento pero se me hace raro tener este tipo de problemas que vengo experimentando desde la version 80 aproximadamente. Espero que alguien pueda ayudarme a encontrar una solución


Imagenes 

La imagen donde el envio es a 28.5Mbps corresponde a Firefox. La otra imagen corresponde a Edge Chromium
